column3: Thanks, this fixes the build for me. :+1:\n\n(But I can't judge how bad this affects users for which harfbuzz works currently.)

utACK f149e31

This [upstream ticket](https://bugreports.qt.io/browse/QTBUG-62320) also partially explains what happened (I haven't tracked down the actual commit). Basically, from 5.8.0, Qt overhauled its build system, and now defaults to `-system-harfbuzz`.

Also discussed with @theuni, and in any case we definitely don't want to be pulling in system harfbuzz, so making this explicit is
